name: Derek Koch
one_liner_about: Product @ Embodied Labs
full_about:
I’m a B2B SaaS product leader who aligns cross-functional teams with market needs and opportunities to advance bold visions. I bring expertise in identifying what value means, delivering big initiatives to turn prospects and customers into enthusiastic evangelists, and growing usage through feature experimentation and delivery. 

I’m known as a driver with great focus, discipline, and analytical ability, but also as a facilitator with a big heart. I’ve led multi-year product rearchitecture and relaunch initiatives to generate 3x revenue growth, spearheaded product strategies and roadmaps that resulted in an exit for founders and investors, and in each case attracted and retained high-performing teams along the way. I empower teams to take action in a creative, decentralized way by democratizing information like KPIs and instituting repeatable processes like Agile.

Taking a personal stake in the success of the company, I work with market and executive leaders to truly understand the vision and define optimal execution. My wheelhouse is turning what needs to be done into challenges the team is inspired to take on.

Feel free to reach out: derek.koch@gmail.com.

85% writer. 85% gamer. 70% podcaster. 95% podcaster. 65% YouTuber. 40% Twitch streamer. 100% bad at percentages. Derek M. Koch is the creator of the 6-Week Rotation (6weekrotation.com) series of superhero novels as well as the Supernatural Solutions: The Marc Temple Casefiles series. He is also the designer behind the RPG supplement Harsch Tables, Volume 1.

If you can’t find him at Monster Kid Writer (monsterkidwriter.com), you can finding Derek producing the Rondo Hatton Classic Horror Award-winning Monster Kid Radio, the weekly podcast devoted to the classic, and sometimes not-so-classic, monster movies of yesteryear; or you can find him on Monster Kid Radio’s YouTube channel or Twitch stream. He is a member of the Monster Kid Hall of Fame and a recipient of the Monster Bash Life Achievement Award.

When not online, you can find Derek at home in the Pacific Northwest either serving his cat Wednesday, playing with his funny-shaped dice, watching a movie from his collection of monster movies, planning his upcoming wedding to his fiancée Beth, or trying to figure out how numbers work.

one_liner_about: Global D&I Leader @ Intuit | Certified Professional Coach, M.Ed. | Previous NFL Athlete
full_about:
With over two decades of experience in sales, customer experience, and diversity, equity, and inclusion (DE&I) programs, I am passionate about empowering people and organizations to achieve their full potential. As the Global DE&I Talent Programs Leader at Intuit, I design and implement innovative strategies to attract, retain, develop, and promote top talent from diverse backgrounds and perspectives. 

I also serve as the Global Co-Chair of the Intuit African Ancestry Network, one of the company's top affinity programs, where I foster a culture of belonging, engagement, and growth for the community. I am motivated by Intuit's mission to power prosperity around the world, and I am committed to creating a positive impact through my work.

In addition to my DE&I leadership role, I am also the Principal and Owner of Damion Wright Consulting, LLC, a professional services company specializing in helping executives and business leaders improve their leadership skills, enhance their performance, team performance, and achieve their professional goals. I leverage my expertise in strategy, world class client relationships, and coaching to provide customized solutions to individuals, teams, or entire organizations.

I am a certified Professional Certified Coach (PCC) by the Co-Active Training Institute, and I have completed the Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Workplace Certificate from the University of South Florida. I also hold a Master of Education (M.Ed.) in Organizational Performance and Change from Colorado State University, and a Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Public Relations, Advertising, and Applied Communication from Weber State University.

name: Ben Smith
one_liner_about: Principal Security Engineer at Amazon Lab126
full_about:
Ben Smith is a seasoned security engineer with over a decade of penetration testing experience. He is an expert at security focused source code review and has routinely performed assessments on some of today's most complex and security critical software.

Throughout his career Ben has regularly performed security reviews in low-level domains targeting embedded systems, hypervisors, kernels, operating system components, trusted execution environments and firmware. He also has particular experience in AI, cloud security architecture, fuzz testing, gaming and software isolation.

Ben is an active security researcher with interest in developing new mitigations and security controls involving compiler extensions, machine learning, static analysis and trusted computing.

Prior to professional roles he achieved first-class honours in Digital Forensics (BSc) writing several papers on malware analysis and reverse engineering. He has worked in various engineering roles for NCC Group, iSEC Partners, SurfControl (now Websense) and Transcom ISP.

Ben has taken several courses including Offensive Security Certified Professional (2008), Web Application Hacker's Handbook Live (2011), Corelan: Advanced Windows Exploitation (2012), Secure Coding in C, C++, Java and multiple machine learning courses.

name: Bob Diamond
one_liner_about: | Attorney | Entrepreneur | Harvard Business School Mentor
full_about:
I am an entrepreneur, attorney, investor, mentor, and wealth creation advisor. I am also the host of the popular podcast PathwaystoProsperity.com.

My passion is helping people achieve financial freedom and time freedom by owning their own highly profitable business that involves helping others. I believe that businesses should give back to help make this a better world.

Two of the areas in which I specialize are tax overages and mortgage overages and I am considered the nations top expert in these two fields.

I also believe in walking my talk, and I am actively involved in running my own businesses in these two areas. We help people recover funds from tax and mortgage overages that are due to them, that in most cases they would never receive without our professional assistance.

I also serve as a mentor for a Harvard MBA Business School startup class. There I help startup teams develop their ideas and businesses. I truly enjoy sharing my knowledge, experience, and expertise with the Harvard MBA students as well as with my students in the Tax and Mortgage Overages workshops that my company offers.

My company, The Wealth Creation Center also offers a variety of powerful home-study courses in overages and other related areas. This is an excellent way to become familiar with the lucrative opportunities in the overage business and to begin helping people get the funds rightfully due to them.

Due to the challenging economic climate in America today, the number and amount of tax and mortgage overages is increasing on nearly a daily basis and there is a growing need for experts in the tax overages and mortgage overages field. My company, The Wealth Creation Center, trains people all around the United States in how to successfully help these people recover funds from government agencies that they would not be able to recover without the assistance of an expert.
…see more

name: Damion Martin
one_liner_about: Cloud Security Engineer @ ATXDefense | GCIH, GCFA, Security+
full_about:
As a cloud security engineer at the United States Air Force, I apply my computer science degree from the Community College of the Air Force and my GCIH certification to protect the cloud infrastructure and data of the military. My core competencies include cyber-security, cyber defense, incident response, security information and event management (SIEM), cloud computing, network security, network administration, and information security.

In my current role, I work with a team of security experts to monitor, detect, analyze, and respond to cyber threats and incidents affecting the cloud systems and services of the Air Force. I use AWS and SIEM tools to perform forensic analysis, mitigation, and remediation of security issues. I also contribute to the development and implementation of security policies, standards, and best practices for the cloud environment. I am passionate about learning new technologies and skills to enhance my cyber-security knowledge and capabilities. I value collaboration, innovation, and excellence in my work, and I strive to bring diverse perspectives and experiences to the team.

name: Damian Rivera
one_liner_about: CEO ALPFA | Executive Coach | Board Member | Angel Investor
full_about:
WE ARE BACK!!!! ALPFA Convention 2024 Go to www.alpfa.org to register!!!

Prior to taking on the CEO role of ALPFA, Damian has been a Managing Director in Accenture’s Utilities practice for 21 years where he started his career as a coder in their Tech Practice. 

Most recently, Damian focused on Customer Care Transformation work for utilities including helping clients with strategically pivoting to digital capabilities as they improved their customer engagement. Damian has performed Digital Transformation Strategy and Implementation, Customer Information System builds, Utility Customer Analytics as well as Customer Care operations work. Through these engagements he worked on all project phases including Strategy Development, System Implementation, Business Process Definition as well as Operations.

Damian holds a B.S. in Chemical Engineering from Rutgers University and is currently in the Columbia University Executive MBA program specializing in Social Entrepreneurship.

Damian’s focus on social entrepreneurship would come as no surprise to people who know him. In addition to his client roles he served as Accenture’s Managing Director responsible for North American Hispanic American Employee Resource Group from 2011 - 2017. In this role he lead the strategic direction of 16 ERG’s across the US engaging in internal career progression as well as local market activities focused on improving the community in which the ERG is based. Damian also serves on the National Board of Directors of Per Scholas, whose mission is to “Break the cycle of poverty by providing technology education, access, training and job placement services for people in under served communities”.

Damian is married to his HS sweetheart Idanis, and has 2 children, Damian Francisco, 17, and Ilanis, 14. Damian enjoys watching his son run track, and watching his daughter also run track and grow in photography. Damian also enjoys triathlons and will be completing his 11th this year.

full_about:
"All views and opinions expressed are my own."

Hey y'all! I'm Damien, a Cloud DevSecOps Engineer who's passionate about building secure, scalable cloud infrastructures. With expertise in cloud security, automation, and multi-cloud environments, I lead projects that streamline DevSecOps practices, reduce technical debt, and enhance incident response. I’ve built high-performance systems, integrated security tools into CI/CD pipelines, and developed frameworks aligned with industry standards. As a contributor to open-source projects like Common Cloud Controls (CCC) and Open Policy Agent (OPA), I’m committed to advancing security practices across cloud environments.

When I'm not coding and building my life away, I love creating content for DevSecOps and Cloud Security, which ultimately led me to create the DevSec Blueprint and my YouTube channel. I am incredibly passionate about educating and empowering others to jump into the Cloud Security and DevSecOps engineering space.

For fun, I love to watch anime (Demon Slayer), play video games (like Persona 5 Royal), and watch videos on YouTube about cars.

name: Damien Martinez
one_liner_about: Cybersecurity Engineer
full_about:
As a seasoned System Administrator and Cybersecurity Engineer with over a decade of experience, I thrive on solving complex challenges and driving impactful results for mission-critical projects. Currently, I serve at the Naval Information Warfare Center Pacific, where I lead initiatives that enhance cybersecurity resilience and operational effectiveness. With an active Top Secret Clearance, my expertise spans across strategic analysis, system administration, cybersecurity practices, and testing & evaluation.

I specialize in planning and managing large-scale projects, ensuring the seamless integration of cybersecurity measures, and providing expert guidance on program resources and operational requirements. My track record includes leading a team of over 10 engineers to deliver timely solutions, orchestrating the administration of 62 mission-critical servers, and spearheading the development and testing of critical system patches within the Navy Risk Management Framework (RMF).

I am adept at cultivating robust client relationships, identifying pain points, and delivering favorable solutions that meet organizational goals. My core competencies include strategic planning, cybersecurity practices, Linux system administration, team training, and cross-functional collaboration.

Key achievements in my career include:

•Leading the implementation of Engineering Change Requests (ECRs) across 100+ Linux and Windows servers, ensuring stringent compliance with STIG requirements.
•Managing and troubleshooting complex configurations in environments using Splunk, Active Directory, and Puppet Configuration Management.
•Delivering SME-level advice in the testing and analysis of Link 16 SSA deadlines, contributing to mission success even under challenging environmental conditions.

My technical proficiencies encompass a wide array of tools and systems, including Red Hat Linux, Windows Server, Python, Bash scripting, and more. I hold certifications in CompTIA Security+ and Linux Professional Institute: Linux Essentials.

name: Damian Silverstrim, PE
one_liner_about: Vice President at AI Engineers, Inc.
full_about:
I lead a group of structural engineers responsible for the load rating of bridges throughout the country. I also provide support for our bridge inspection and structural health monitoring contracts. Our work is conducted in accordance the requirements of AASHTO, FHWA, NBIS, and agency guidelines, for clients including ConnDOT, RIDOT, MaineDOT, NYSDOT, PennDOT, MDT, VDOT, ITD, NYSBA, SCDOT, TBTA, NDOT, INDOT, UDOT, MassDOT, Massport Authority and the MBTA. 
I have load rated and reviewed thousands bridges and am familiar with AASHTO LRFR, LFR, and ASR rating analysis and Strength, Service and Fatigue limit states. Types of structures I have load rated include many complex structures such as trusses (including gusset plates), post-tensioned structures, movable bridges, curved steel bridges, floor-systems, and substructures including integral pier caps, timber bent caps, and timber piles. I have also installed sensors on signature structures (trusses, steel arches) and bridges with unknown plans to verify and refine load rating models and determine the efficacy of rehabilitation through live load testing.

I am also an NBIS Team Leader, SPRAT certified, and Professional Engineer (PE). I am licensed in CT, NY, RI, VA, ME, MT, MI, MN, ID, IN, NC, NV, ND, UT, OR and SC.
…see more

About
I am a senior at the Eli Broad College of Business at Michigan State University, pursuing a bachelor’s degree in finance with a minor in entrepreneurship. Before attending MSU, I completed 84 college credits during high school, earning two associate degrees and two certificates alongside my high school diploma, demonstrating a strong foundation in academics and a drive for excellence.

My professional journey began with an internship at State Street Title Agency, where I gained exposure to business operations through order entry and pre-processing tasks. I have also developed a versatile skill set through roles such as a seasonal fulfillment specialist at Target and conservation work at Philmont Scout Ranch, both of which honed my ability to thrive in fast-paced and dynamic environments.

At MSU, I served as co-president of the Michigan State University Entrepreneurship Association (MSUEA) during my junior year. In this role, I helped cultivate an entrepreneurial mindset among students by organizing initiatives that foster innovation, collaboration, and practical business skills.

In addition to my academic and leadership experiences, I am the founder of TrailEagle Packs LLC, a startup focused on creating innovative outdoor gear. This venture aligns with my passion for business innovation and reflects my entrepreneurial vision. I am excited to continue leveraging the resources and opportunities at the Broad College of Business to grow as a leader and drive my venture forward.
